intro: Citrophorum, commonly known as the goldenrod, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Citrophorum species are herbaceous perennials, typically growing between 1 to 3 meters in height.
